attributes.action: Link MPs pay to the average of the six main public service pay review bodies.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed post 2015 general election pay rise of 9% for MPs should be scrapped.

MPs should have a pay reward calculated as an average of the following main 6 public sector pay review bodies.

The Armed Forces Pay Review Body (AFPRB), NHS Pay Review Body (NHSPRB), the Doctors’ and Dentists’ Review Body (DDRB), Prison Service Pay Review Body (PSPRB), and the Senior Salaries Review Body (SSRB)
